subject: Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-31 11:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-31 13:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-07-31 17:51:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 11:54:06.000000000', 'message': "Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: Ia05fc004e11eada426bc81c45bbc3732b9126bbe
"}]
commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: Ia05fc004e11eada426bc81c45bbc3732b9126bbe

commit_message:
WIP track upgrade status in mistral env

In order to be able to track the progress of the upgrade
this review add the status for each steps in mistral env
This is POC for now, maybe in a near futur we can totaly
skip the selection of the steps manually, by adding
something more automated.
Like steps['ctlplane'] is Done, so now give me a set of
non controller nodes to upgrade
(with a such solution, we should still keep an option to
enforce the step)

Change-Id: I08c20e02c41417e75c7a205ac82754735ec6fced

subject: WIP - Ansible driven Upgrade for Neutron service
messages:
[{'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2016-06-08 08:50:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2016-06-08 08:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2016-06-08 09:05:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This is pretty interesting - do you have a spec or any other notes on how this is supposed to work?

Like, for example, what happens if you upgrade neutron and it pulls in a bunch of common packages used by other services?

I can see this working well in a containerized environment, but I'm not sure it will work so well (unless we always upgrade all services on a specific node at the same time) with our current implementation.

Can you provide a bit more context please?

Also interested how this may intersect with the puppet configuration of services, e.g will ansible just drive the service state, package update and DB sync, or could we conceivably run the service configuration via a similar method in due course?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-08 09:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-tripleo-heat-templates-puppet-lint http://logs.openstack.org/23/326923/2/check/gate-tripleo-heat-templates-puppet-lint/b1c298a/ : SUCCESS in 3m 59s
- gate-tripleo-heat-templates-puppet-syntax-3-centos-7 http://logs.openstack.org/23/326923/2/check/gate-tripleo-heat-templates-puppet-syntax-3-centos-7/fce63c4/ : SUCCESS in 2m 22s
- gate-tripleo-heat-templates-puppet-syntax-4-centos-7 http://logs.openstack.org/23/326923/2/check/gate-tripleo-heat-templates-puppet-syntax-4-centos-7/73697f8/ : SUCCESS in 3m 48s
- gate-tripleo-heat-templates-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/23/326923/2/check/gate-tripleo-heat-templates-pep8/55dd6b3/ : SUCCESS in 3m 02s'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2016-06-08 09:45:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

hey man, so I see this is probably an alternative poc/approach. 

The implication is we say 'upgrade neutron' and then all neutron service components are upgraded, vs being very explicit/fine-grained about which of those and in what order.

We should talk some more about this on a next call, we should do one soon"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2016-06-08 09:52:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> This is pretty interesting - do you have a spec or any other notes
 > on how this is supposed to work?
 > 
 > Like, for example, what happens if you upgrade neutron and it pulls
 > in a bunch of common packages used by other services?
 > 
 > I can see this working well in a containerized environment, but I'm
 > not sure it will work so well (unless we always upgrade all
 > services on a specific node at the same time) with our current
 > implementation.
 > 
 > Can you provide a bit more context please?
 > 

the context is https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/overcloud-upgrades-per-service - jistr has a POC  at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/321416/ which we've used for discussion/working out details (ongoing) on how this will run. He's since broken that out e.g. to glance @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324331/ - rhallisey started an etherpad at https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/tripleo-composable-upgrades and we're taking services each and writing out the ansible roles/tasks for that - which is what this is from matbu. It is slightly different to the current POC pattern (see glance above or heat @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/325835/ ) hence my questions/comments here. 'We' is jistr matbu rhallisey social (lucas) me and we meet spontaneously, typically on #tripleo and then bluejeans, every few days (anyone can propose a call)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-08 12:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build failed (check-tripleo pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

(1 comment)

I ran through an upgrade procedure and it failed on trying to do the "manila-manage db sync" command. This was reported through "openstack stack failures list overcloud --long". It was ultimately caused by the manila-mange command attempting to open the /var/log/manila/manila-manage.log file and getting an IOError: Permission Denied when doing so. Looking at the upstream documentation for setting up the Manila service [0], it seems to imply that this command should be run as the root user. Maybe a "sudo" would fix it?

The offending stack trace if needed is at [1], and the full, unedited log is at [2]. Let me know if you need any help!

[0] - https://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/shared-file-systems/draft/install-controller-rdo.html
[1] - http://paste.openstack.org/show/611624/
[2] - http://paste.openstack.org/show/611630/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-07 20:11:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

[{'created': '2017-06-06 07:04:58.000000000', 'message': "Handle upgrading manila-share under pacemaker

Add upgrade tasks for manila-share when it's controlled by pacemaker:

o Stop the service before the entire pacemaker cluster is stopped.
  This ensures the service is stopped before infrastructure services
  (e.g. rabbitmq) go away.
o Migrate the manila DB prior to restarting the service. This covers
  the situation when puppet-manila (who otherwise would handle the db
  sync) isn't managing the service.
o Start the service after the rest of the pacemaker cluster has been
  started.

This is a copy of the same patch for cinder-volume service:
I5874ab862964fadb68320d5c4de39b20f53dc25c

Change-Id: I4d706efc1f03847233347ff47154bfa59931b444
Related-To: I5874ab862964fadb68320d5c4de39b20f53dc25c
"}]
commit_message:
Handle upgrading manila-share under pacemaker

Add upgrade tasks for manila-share when it's controlled by pacemaker:

o Stop the service before the entire pacemaker cluster is stopped.
  This ensures the service is stopped before infrastructure services
  (e.g. rabbitmq) go away.
o Migrate the manila DB prior to restarting the service. This covers
  the situation when puppet-manila (who otherwise would handle the db
  sync) isn't managing the service.
o Start the service after the rest of the pacemaker cluster has been
  started.

This is a copy of the same patch for cinder-volume service:
I5874ab862964fadb68320d5c4de39b20f53dc25c

Change-Id: I4d706efc1f03847233347ff47154bfa59931b444
Related-To: I5874ab862964fadb68320d5c4de39b20f53dc25c

Add pull-puppet-modules script to binaries

The script landed with 69173bb but was not added to added so the
scripts variable of setup.cfg.

commit_message:
Implement predictable placement feature

This patch add a predictable_placement_map variable that can be used to
arbitrarily assign labels to available nodes to specify their
destination of use

Closes-Bug: 1661317
Change-Id: Ib3ea337e3bc8a47d5659e028ed6dc29470a61f3f

commit_message:
Add support for cinder::volume::rbd hiera parameters

This patch updates cinder_rbd_pool_name and cinder_rbd_user_name
in tripleo::profile::base::cinder::volume::rbd to look at hiera
data before falling back to the default value

Change-Id: I1449ac7e7c93810a34d7e1ce89e8df410ba3e8a1
Depends-On: I1921115cb6218c7554348636c404245c79937673

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 1.8 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.
Use WritableLogger class from the loggers module of the oslo.log
library.

Change-Id: I5344336ecbf5282f7ffcb929e170c4e549741553

commit_message:
Documentation of complex data in ExtraConfig

Provide an example using SR-IOV passthrough data of how complex
structured data can be passed through hiera preserved as strings.

Change-Id: Ic201c11f628bfa109c94039eb17373cb0d91f8b0

commit_message:
Document Ceph repo switch for Upgrade

In some cases, the repo switch tools or commands won't enable
the Jewel repo, which would result of the non-upgrade of the
Ceph services and nodes

Change-Id: Ib154da80c9acca72433df0160116803b29f5449a

commit_message:
Add missing Swift containersync service for containerized deployments

This patch adds the missing Swift containersync service when using a
container deployment. While Swift is somewhat working without it, this
is required to fully support container to container synchronization
between different clusters.

Change-Id: I53c92f0b47882ef0ce4dd7619421806a79a0625c
Depends-On: I6c1f953efe5df32160719ea1de2dd718f281cec0

commit_message:
Modified glance stores parameter values

The stores parameter should be set with the new parameters
as they are going to be deprecated in the old method.

Change-Id: If272345e96988778ceccb8f2f624db1c38aea365
Closes-Bug: 1704327
(cherry picked from commit acafaf0bdeac625d634e62ce4cfdaac2b46aa812)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-17 03:46:34.000000000', 'message': 'docker-puppet.py bind mount /etc/puppet/ readonly

This change is proposed to avoid the complexity of copying in
/etc/puppet from /tmp, and to enforce no writes to /etc/puppet in the
invocation of docker-puppet.py.

The problem of specifying the step number by writing out a file
/etc/puppet/hieradata/docker_step_{{step}}.json for each step, and
including the appropriate step by setting the fact
uuid=docker_step_$STEP when calling puppet apply.

Other minor changes include:
- calling --tags "$PUPPET_TAGS" always, since they are never empty
- if the step is not specified, default to 5, since there is no such
  step as 6

Change-Id: I794aa7022390685a0c038f33841b023f3e149844

commit_message:
Specify step as a fact, mount /etc/puppet readonly

Since the hiera value step is the one value which can change on each
invocation of puppet it would be better passed in as an argument
instead of persisted to a hieradata file.

For containers this allows /etc/puppet to be mounted directly as
read-only. This avoids the complexity of copying in
/etc/puppet from /tmp.

Change-Id: I794aa7022390685a0c038f33841b023f3e149844

commit_message:
tripleo-ci/master release: set retries=0 in yum.conf

as a workaround for the networking problems we're hitting in some infra
regions, we set retries=0 in yum.conf to indefinitely retry a mirror

Change-Id: Iacfc85bd466fd4237bd29fb71ae927981464ddb7

[{'created': '2018-07-10 18:56:11.000000000', 'message': 'unquiesce instance after quiesce failure

If the call to compute_rpcapi.quisece_instance() raises an exception,
any uncaught exception will break out of the function
snapshot_volume_backed(). This can leave the instance in frozen state.

This patch adds a blanket Exception catch to the try block and calls
compute_rpcapi.unquiesce_instance() before reraising.

This has been seen in the wild with RPC timeouts, but this is not the
only possible genesis for an unknown error from quiesce_instance.

Change-Id: Idca5998da8bb42b29a8fffdf52b4af3a043c6326
Closes-Bug: #1754360
(cherry picked from commit 1e77faaa412ab9909dd9491cab4a819b5c84d3e8)

commit_message:
unquiesce instance after quiesce failure

If the call to compute_rpcapi.quisece_instance() raises an exception,
any uncaught exception will break out of the function
snapshot_volume_backed(). This can leave the instance in frozen state.

This patch adds a blanket Exception catch to the try block and calls
compute_rpcapi.unquiesce_instance() before reraising.

This has been seen in the wild with RPC timeouts, but this is not the
only possible genesis for an unknown error from quiesce_instance.

Change-Id: Idca5998da8bb42b29a8fffdf52b4af3a043c6326
Closes-Bug: #1754360
(cherry picked from commit 1e77faaa412ab9909dd9491cab4a819b5c84d3e8)

commit_message:
Filter out non-ASCII characters on invalid UTF8

When an enumerate is done, it is possible that the iDRAC may return
invalid UTF8 that contains non-ASCII characters.  This causes an
XMLSyntaxError to be thrown.  This fix detects that situation and
filters out all non-ASCII characters to bypass the error.

See the following bug for further details:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-dracclient/+bug/1779412

Closes-Bug: #1779412
Change-Id: I5003785dee922920dcdd95c8d7e2a26e0bf97a7d

[{'created': '2018-07-18 12:59:07.000000000', 'message': "Handle HostMappingNotFound when deleting a compute service

If the compute service we're deleting has never been
discovered (mapped to a cell using discover_hosts) or the
host mapping was already deleted, we need to handle the
HostMappingNotFound error when deleting a compute service
so that we (1) don't 500 out of the API and (2) continue to
delete the compute service.

Change-Id: I0d7644db3537a67b94e75972b3c4fce25a623763
Closes-Bug: #1780727
(cherry picked from commit ee6e0c1e7eb861e56915c5b6c60a214b75240366)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle HostMappingNotFound when deleting a compute service

If the compute service we're deleting has never been
discovered (mapped to a cell using discover_hosts) or the
host mapping was already deleted, we need to handle the
HostMappingNotFound error when deleting a compute service
so that we (1) don't 500 out of the API and (2) continue to
delete the compute service.

Change-Id: I0d7644db3537a67b94e75972b3c4fce25a623763
Closes-Bug: #1780727
(cherry picked from commit ee6e0c1e7eb861e56915c5b6c60a214b75240366)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 13:17:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix TypeError in prep_resize allocation cleanup

The CachingScheduler doesn't create allocations in
placement so when prep_resize fails and it tries
to revert allocations, the _revert_allocation() method
returns False and then prep_resize calls
delete_allocation_for_failed_resize() which since change
I7891b98f225f97ad47f189afb9110ef31c810717 has taken a
context argument, but that's not being passed so it
results in a TypeError.

This fixes the TypeError and adds a functional test case
which runs a resize reschedule scenario with the
CachingScheduler.

Change-Id: I0ec0c2d3f7ef8d2274b97a28a175d53921edc9db
Closes-Bug: #1781100
(cherry picked from commit 78af1de1587fb83e09d1c0639fb5a28eb6e51a27)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError in prep_resize allocation cleanup

The CachingScheduler doesn't create allocations in
placement so when prep_resize fails and it tries
to revert allocations, the _revert_allocation() method
returns False and then prep_resize calls
delete_allocation_for_failed_resize() which since change
I7891b98f225f97ad47f189afb9110ef31c810717 has taken a
context argument, but that's not being passed so it
results in a TypeError.

This fixes the TypeError and adds a functional test case
which runs a resize reschedule scenario with the
CachingScheduler.

Change-Id: I0ec0c2d3f7ef8d2274b97a28a175d53921edc9db
Closes-Bug: #1781100
(cherry picked from commit 78af1de1587fb83e09d1c0639fb5a28eb6e51a27)

commit_message:
Fix share-service VM restart problem

The /etc/mtab file may have mount information such as 'nfsd'
that if copied to /etc/fstab will cause the share server to
hang when rebooted.

Update /etc/fstab with exactly the newly mounted or unmounted
shares rather than simply overwriting /etc/fstab with /etc/mtab.

Change-Id: I67602bae1f928769d768008deca7bd0f2fef1ac2
Close-Bug: #1639662
(cherry picked from commit b76934770b0f42950cad35a3e2a5a8e060462332)
(cherry picked from commit 344d4aa91c848447002d1b297884d52060d274b2)

commit_message:

commit_message:
Unit tests: Fix slow Manila test

We were retrying the create due to the client_plugin being mocked out,
which resulted in the test taking >60s instead of ~0.3s.

Change-Id: I14d0a88b94f7e56e03683021c9c29a55dac9e516
Story: #1745010
Task: 23347

commit_message:
List deployment failures on deployment failure

On deployment failure, a general deployment failure message is displayed
along with either a list of stack resources or deployment failures based
on the deployment phase the deployment failed at

Implements: blueprint config-download-ui
Change-Id: Ide45310ebbaf428b960c7db467777e75ff755529

[{'created': '2018-06-13 14:15:10.000000000', 'message': 'Adds docker SFC and cleans up ODL envs

There are now duplicate places where environment files for deployments
are kept.  Those include environments/ and environments/services.  The
files in environments/ are incorrect and should be removed to leave only
a single place (environments/services) to store docker services.
environments/services-baremetal house the legacy bm services.

This patch also adds a missing docker service for SFC so that we can
also include an ODL SFC docker env file.

Change-Id: If70818db9577b7d80c4acd0d0577d9432b5c8bef
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit cfb5fdbd22cd81027018a0809f7466640ea0f0d6)

commit_message:
Adds docker SFC and cleans up ODL envs

There are now duplicate places where environment files for deployments
are kept.  Those include environments/ and environments/services.  The
files in environments/ are incorrect and should be removed to leave only
a single place (environments/services) to store docker services.
environments/services-baremetal house the legacy bm services.

This patch also adds a missing docker service for SFC so that we can
also include an ODL SFC docker env file.

Change-Id: If70818db9577b7d80c4acd0d0577d9432b5c8bef
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit cfb5fdbd22cd81027018a0809f7466640ea0f0d6)
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WIP DNR Add some local stanzas to haproxy

This helps prefer locality but it is really just a POC to
explore a few ideas.

Change-Id: I7ed62ceb5a351f7194b42c96c01cbcc02b5f9aba

commit_message:
Enable mistral mod_wsgi in undercloud

Make mistral run under apache in the undercloud. The desire is to have
as many services running under apache as possible.

Change-Id: I29bec188519b43eac37a45425cc5af25f043ef0c
Depends-On: I61199f53d7e32fcb3d068ccaf548a836b5bb58e9

commit_message:
implement scenario008 for containerized composable networker deployment

3 controllers, 2 compute and 2 networker nodes.

(1 comment)

Hi, thank you for looking into this bug.

The way you instantiated the loggers is not the way we do it in the project. You can grep for "LOG" to see the usual way, and do something similar in all the files that need it.

You should also run the pep8 and unit tests locally before sending your patch - you can do this by running "tox" before submitting the patch, and fixing the problems locally until all the errors are gone. The unit tests failures indicate that there isn't a one to one match between print() and logging statements so we need to be careful here, and make sure to feed a string to the logs.

If you have questions or get stuck, feel free to ask - here, on the mailing or the #tripleo channel on IRC ( https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC ) is usually a good place.'}, {'account_id': 18009, 'date': '2017-09-18 09:14:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

WIP: Replacing print statement with log

Removing the print statements from tripleoclient and replace with log.(debug|info|warning)
Closes-Bug: #1617199

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2016-01-12 22:23:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

So overall this looks like a good direction, but I'm -1 because I feel the impact and burden on users configuring tempest is too great. I think we need to think about having a fast path available that only does a subset of things but is good enough for most cases. We don't want to force are users to use the new file which adds another syntax and complexity to already lengthy configuration process.

I also feel like this spec is optimizing too much for edge conditions when the majority of the time tests just need an image and flavor for booting. Even ssh information about guests come in as a secondary concern and is only needed for a small number of tests by comparison. The internal interfaces are adding a lot of declarations around everything, this will add a lot more noise to the code."}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2016-01-12 22:55:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Add bp tempest-resources

Remove tempest conf dependencies from run time test resource
details. Introduce resource.yml to define test resources as
a dedicated configuration file. Allow for tests to run against
matrixes of test resources.

Change-Id: Ie6fb25402d8d3b1d49fed906d4a62d91836c9cba

I agree with the concerns raised by jrist and jpich, so I'm -1 on this. What would be the benefits of doing this? Maybe update the commit message and add especially the "why" part.'}, {'account_id': 20970, 'date': '2017-09-02 05:55:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Semicolons are a matter of style.  In either case, prettier will insert/remove them for you.  I'd argue that it makes the code look more modern, but of course that's subjective.  It's not a complication, it's a matter of aesthetics.

I find the git history argument unconvincing.  Git history is additive, and not mutable.  No information will be lost.  Yes, for a while you might have to do a bit of extra work when git-blaming.  A few months ago, we did a much more extensive, global update[1] based purely on style, and the git argument didn't even come up.

https://standardjs.com/ suggests that semicolon-free code is better.

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ui/commit/0567f6592952fc08d1e04ff246952a82c453c47c"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-18 11:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 02:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-31 17:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

@dmitry, for IPv4 ironic is updating the port with extra_dhcp_opts, this only covers dhcp options. so we wont be able to pass in the dhcp-range or the pxe/ipxe tag setting. revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-07 16:22:37.000000000', 'message': "Configure dnsmasq for provisioning over IPv6

dnsmasq wont give out an static IP address to a device if it
has already given out that IP to the same MAC address with a
different dhcp6 ClientID or IAID[1]

when provisioning over IPv6 this is a problem because these ID's change
between the dhcp client in PXE, iPXE and in the deployed OS.

In order to work around this we need to use statless addressing, but we
still need dnsmasq as PXE doesn't appear to support statless addressing
and dhcp is still needed in order to provide the bootfile-url for both
tftp and http

So on the provisioning network the boot process looks like this
PXE -
   IP and bootfile-url from dnsmasq over dhcp6
iPXE -
   IP using the statless IP being advertised by radvd
   bootfile-url from dnsmasq over dhcp6
deployed OS
   IP using the statless IP being advertised by radvd

[1] - http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2017q1/011267.html

Change-Id: I5b9414b0e3a7e644461e8173f12b3b3a70a2ead6
"}]
commit_message:
Configure dnsmasq for provisioning over IPv6

dnsmasq wont give out an static IP address to a device if it
has already given out that IP to the same MAC address with a
different dhcp6 ClientID or IAID[1]

when provisioning over IPv6 this is a problem because these ID's change
between the dhcp client in PXE, iPXE and in the deployed OS.

In order to work around this we need to use statless addressing, but we
still need dnsmasq as PXE doesn't appear to support statless addressing
and dhcp is still needed in order to provide the bootfile-url for both
tftp and http

So on the provisioning network the boot process looks like this
PXE -
   IP and bootfile-url from dnsmasq over dhcp6
iPXE -
   IP using the statless IP being advertised by radvd
   bootfile-url from dnsmasq over dhcp6
deployed OS
   IP using the statless IP being advertised by radvd

[1] - http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2017q1/011267.html

Change-Id: I5b9414b0e3a7e644461e8173f12b3b3a70a2ead6

commit_message:
WIP Handle using encryption by default for pacemaker in upgrade

This requires us to comment the secauth configuration option from the
corosync conf file. This enables it by default when the corresponding
THT parameter is set to true (which it is) and thus allows us to use
encryption on upgrades. We also distribute the corosync authkey
to all nodes before we start the cluster.

Change-Id: I1231ffe7eff62a20a776f4b331a6a6ce01b02e00
Depends-On: I349b8bf79eeeaa4ddde1c17b7014603913f184cf
Depends-On: Id066f644e08ac9860c38c22607c55e6da60a1675

[{'created': '2017-10-11 18:34:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes OpenDaylight deployments docker support

Rather than copy all of the env files used in traditional deployments to
enable other ODL deployment scenarios, this patch modifies the docker
env file to only include the docker related changes.  This allows a user
to deploy any ODL related scenario by including the docker env file arg
after specifying the traditional service env file argument.

Closes-Bug: 1722881

Change-Id: I3938593eaaa47a32df2a9a9a5ffe3bd9b4560db3
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fixes OpenDaylight deployments docker support

Rather than copy all of the env files used in traditional deployments to
enable other ODL deployment scenarios, this patch modifies the docker
env file to only include the docker related changes.  This allows a user
to deploy any ODL related scenario by including the docker env file arg
after specifying the traditional service env file argument.

Closes-Bug: 1722881

Change-Id: I3938593eaaa47a32df2a9a9a5ffe3bd9b4560db3
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

In containerized deployment gating, a simple change can lead to a
cascade of packages and containers to be rebuilt. Letting all the
containers to update packages from remote repositories may take too long
to meet gate timeout requirements.
This is one of the approach possible, create a local repo synced from
the remote, from which all the containers can take their packages
The role
- identifies enabled delorean repos
- syncs them locally
- create repos out of the local dir
- installs and execute a lighttpd to serve the repos
- create repo files to use those repos, using default ipv4 address

On current ovb test environment, the complete repos sync may take up to
7 minutes.

Change-Id: Idd015e49c44b63f63be40b31cdfc0e9c2fc2d506
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] locally sync delorean repo

In containerized deployment gating, a simple change can lead to a
cascade of packages and containers to be rebuilt. Letting all the
containers to update packages from remote repositories may take too long
to meet gate timeout requirements.
This is one of the approach possible, create a local repo synced from
the remote, from which all the containers can take their packages
The role
- identifies enabled delorean repos
- syncs them locally
- create repos out of the local dir
- installs and execute a lighttpd to serve the repos
- create repo files to use those repos, using default ipv4 address

On current ovb test environment, the complete repos sync may take up to
7 minutes.

Change-Id: Idd015e49c44b63f63be40b31cdfc0e9c2fc2d506

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-15 11:39:34.000000000', 'message': "Add missing Swift services for containerized deployments

This patch adds three missing Swift services when using a container
deployment. While Swift is somewhat working without them, these are
required to fully support storage policies, erasure coding and container
to container synchronization between different clusters.

Note that the Swift container reconciler users the proxy container
image. This is intended; in fact the swift-container-reconciler is
packaged in the openstack-swift-proxy rpm due to it's affinity to the
proxy services.

Change-Id: I46209fededb0982cabad166d6f0fc3f94d40af90
"}, {'created': '2017-04-26 14:15:43.000000000', 'message': "Add missing Swift services for containerized deployments

This patch adds three missing Swift services when using a container
deployment. While Swift is somewhat working without them, these are
required to fully support storage policies, erasure coding and container
to container synchronization between different clusters.

Note that the Swift container reconciler users the proxy container
image. This is intended; in fact the swift-container-reconciler is
packaged in the openstack-swift-proxy rpm due to it's affinity to the
proxy services.

Depends-On: If388bcc1532d7db2132d4b206e13252a30fa9041
Change-Id: I46209fededb0982cabad166d6f0fc3f94d40af90
"}, {'created': '2017-05-02 17:45:31.000000000', 'message': "Add missing Swift services for containerized deployments

This patch adds three missing Swift services when using a container
deployment. While Swift is somewhat working without them, these are
required to fully support storage policies, erasure coding and container
to container synchronization between different clusters.

Note that the Swift container reconciler users the proxy container
image. This is intended; in fact the swift-container-reconciler is
packaged in the openstack-swift-proxy rpm due to it's affinity to the

commit_message:
Add missing Swift object reconstructor for containerized deployments

This patch adds the missing Swift object reconstructor service when
using a container deployment. While Swift is somewhat working without
it, this is required to fully support erasure coding.

Depends-On: If388bcc1532d7db2132d4b206e13252a30fa9041
Change-Id: I46209fededb0982cabad166d6f0fc3f94d40af90

commit_message:
Drop default HostnameFormatDefault parameter from roles defintions.

HostnameFormatDefault parameter defined in roles mimics values
generated from overcloud.j2.yaml:
    default: "%stackname%-{{role.name.lower()}}-%index%"

At the same time some role definitions don't have this parameter
set. For consistency it's dropped from all roles where it's defined
and may be set later if needed.

Change-Id: I541426fd51046477022e6b77dbad5e76ece03172

commit_message:
Only deploy cloud when environment tag used

Apply the environment tag to the undercloud and overcloud setup. If
you're simply trying to teardown an environment, then the undercloud
and overcloud environment setup gets in the way.

Change-Id: Ic65d5dacbdd10af3f3257751b4d4fb7b29926e51

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
So we should switch to stestr.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: If306e0fdf7a63d800524240c77eebcc4f26d129c

> Do we still need that ?

Apologies for the delay Mathieu! Yes, unfortunately we need this or another similar command that updates the stack given new environment files provided by the user. The `openstack overcloud update stack` command doesn't provide this at present."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-11-09 11:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2017-11-13 21:25:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2017-11-13 21:26:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased

so whats the status with this one is it being re-instated? 

I can see the value of a stand-alone 'generate the playbooks' cli - they _could_ use "openstack stack update --init-minor-update" though  to achieve the same? Or we wire up the same mistral workflow to some new top-level cli (like openstack stack update --generate-playbooks), or just rename --init-minor-update if it is just the name which is different.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

> > Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased
 > 
 > so whats the status with this one is it being re-instated?
 > 
 > I can see the value of a stand-alone 'generate the playbooks' cli -
 > they _could_ use "openstack stack update --init-minor-update"
 > though  to achieve the same? Or we wire up the same mistral
 > workflow to some new top-level cli (like openstack stack update
 > --generate-playbooks), or just rename --init-minor-update if it is
 > just the name which is different.

ah - i see from lyarwood's comments above it might be because we also need to add the option of environment files here? So a new cli can allow us to do that without changing the minor update behaviour. ?'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2017-11-14 08:20:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

It can be a short term solution for now.
For the major upgrade in Queens, it will be possible to add whatever --extra-vars to the openstack overcloud upgrade command.
So the FFU can use this entry point instead of the overcloud deploy command.
Idk how much you need this for now, if you can wait a little bit so that the major upgrade implementation can be landed in queens, then we won't need this patch."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2017-11-14 09:29:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: -Code-Review

> It can be a short term solution for now.
 > For the major upgrade in Queens, it will be possible to add
 > whatever --extra-vars to the openstack overcloud upgrade command.
 > So the FFU can use this entry point instead of the overcloud deploy
 > command.

Yeah reusing the major upgrade command might work if we can add additional envs _and_ it has the same --init switch.

 > Idk how much you need this for now, if you can wait a little bit so
 > that the major upgrade implementation can be landed in queens, then
 > we won't need this patch.

Unfortunately this change no longer works anyway against a stable/newton deployed env, something that was missed for a while as I was essentially using stable/pike THT in my test env without noticing.

We do however really need something ASAP that can update the stack outputs to test FFU so I started working on the following yesterday:

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/(project:openstack/tripleo-common+OR+project:openstack/python-tripleoclient)+topic:bp/fast-forward-upgrades+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This introduces a workaround ffu command that passes the extra envs to the same underlying mistral action as `update stack` to update the stack outputs. Still a WIP but might be useful enough in the short term until the above major upgrade command lands somewhere.

I'll ask Lukas to close this review out when he gets back from PTO, thanks again."}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-11-15 15:02:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-31 17:21:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
Add setup-heat-outputs option to get heat stack outputs

For minor update workflow we need heat stack outputs but we
don't want to touch actual deployment, for that we noop most of
the tasks.

Change-Id: I2c12255fce11a8f6976fe5afc76357446c1e32aa

commit_message:
Cleanup libvirt driver for BIOS emulator

- changed to create namedtuple class at module level
- changed to use list when defining namedtuple attributes
- fixed docstring param 'update' name

Followup to I3b9e7683934e4448bedf3933f1a2fe222d70c208

Change-Id: I73bfc62568d36eefd8dcef2c85f15dd55b55ed04

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 2011, 'name': 'Ian Main', 'email': 'imain@redhat.com', 'username': 'imain'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-19 17:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-10-20 11:31:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

i added this bit for the undercloud deploy since that does not use tripleo-ansible-inventory. it seemed easiest to just make the data available as a var directly in the task.

they could instead use the ServerIdData output, or add something to their inventory/var that sets bootstrap_server_id=deploy_server_id, which should be the case since it's single server.

either way, this would require a code change for undercloud deploy"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-20 11:57:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

James thanks for clarifying, I'll mark this WIP and look into the undercloud deploy part, seems like we should be able to do that the same way we do for tripleo-ansible-inventory (which is as you say using the ServerIdData output)"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-20 12:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok discussion on IRC indicates this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509586/4/tripleoclient/v1/undercloud_deploy.py may be sufficient as it hard-codes the deploy_server_id and bootstrap_server_id to "undercloud" in the ansible-playbook invocation?'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-20 12:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow

Removing WIP as I think this is OK, dprince is going to test and leave feedback to confirm'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-10-31 09:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-10-31 13:48:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hard coding the 'hosts' could be a problem for the undercloud_deploy installer. Our existing (hard coded) inventory looks something like this:

[targets]
overcloud ansible_connection=local

[Undercloud]
overcloud

[undercloud]
overcloud"}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-10-31 19:29:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2017-11-02 10:35:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2011, 'date': '2017-11-02 20:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This is breaking the containerized/ansiblized undercloud deployment'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-31 17:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-19 17:08:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove str_replace for bootstrap_server_id in deploy_steps.j2

This was recently added via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505827
but I don't think it should be required, because we already set this
via vars in the tripleo-ansible-inventory.

Also, we need to move away from the name based lookup of '0' as it'll
break if the first controller is ever removed (this is actually
a regression which crept in during the switch to containers I think,
and this doesn't completely fix it)

Change-Id: I92a4566c101de0f3b37eec5479efd559d1d740a3
Partial-Bug: #1724888

commit_message:
Remove str_replace for bootstrap_server_id in deploy_steps.j2

This was recently added via https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505827
but I don't think it should be required, because we already set this
via vars in the tripleo-ansible-inventory.

Also, we need to move away from the name based lookup of '0' as it'll
break if the first controller is ever removed (this is actually
a regression which crept in during the switch to containers I think,
and this doesn't completely fix it)

Change-Id: I92a4566c101de0f3b37eec5479efd559d1d740a3
Partial-Bug: #1724888

I spent some time looking at the scenario001 failure, it's unhappy I think because fluentd runs on BM and all the other services run in container.

            "Error: Could not create user fluentd: Execution of '/usr/sbin/useradd -G ceilometer,cinder,glance,gnocchi,haclient,heat,keystone,neutron,nova,root -M fluentd' returned 6: useradd: group 'ceilometer' does not exist",
            "useradd: group 'glance' does not exist",
            "useradd: group 'gnocchi' does not exist",
            "useradd: group 'heat' does not exist",
            "useradd: group 'keystone' does not exist",
            "useradd: group 'neutron' does not exist",
            "useradd: group 'nova' does not exist",

This may be fixed when we switch to containerized fluentd service in scenario001 since the user should already exist in the container image.
The containerized fluentd service is ready, now we "just" need a container image to use in CI, i.e https://hub.docker.com/r/tripleoupstream/centos-binary-fluentd/ with tag passed-ci.

I personally tried docker.io/tripleopike/centos-binary-fluentd:current-tripleo in my environment and puppet seemed happy.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-10-26 09:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-10-26 20:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-31 17:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-08 21:10:31.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: change devmode to deploy containerized services by default

** quick and dirty patch **
with this change devmode will deploy containerized services in the
overcloud by default when devmode is not in gate mode.
Since gate for containerized deployments is still work in progress the
new default will not apply for gate mode. Gate mode will still deploy a
non containerized overcloud
Two options added
--no-containerized-deployment to change the default for non-gate mode
--force-containerized-deployment to force containers even in gate mode

Change-Id: I5e742615d54d09b788d987c30ee6a887853c25d6

commit_message:
Change devmode to deploy containerized services by default

With this change devmode will deploy containerized services in the
overcloud by default when devmode for releases Pike and later.

Since the option to update containers has been added, gate jobs will
also run with a containerized overcloud by default for relevant
releases. Updating containers is enabled by default in devmode and
the ci-scripts when deploying with a containerized overcloud.

Two options are added:
--non-containerized-overcloud to change the default for non-gate mode
--containerized-overcloud to force containerized overcloud even in gate mode

Depends-On: I7fc3a83c95a76fe5005eeb084ad044fee9084bdb
Change-Id: I5e742615d54d09b788d987c30ee6a887853c25d6

commit_message:
Adding HeatEngineVolumes and HeatEngineOptEnvVars support

Change-Id: Icf9b40eed56f69a7ebe4d6c22e6365c2e90a7209
Closes-Bug: #1777852
(cherry picked from commit 637f335d105a2a14c024d12c4729a09cd4c88673)

commit_message:
Make service check output more verbose.

Checks used to assert services' status post upgrade don't log
much on success or failure, for e.g:
  Waiting for haproxy pcs resource to start
  FAILURE: Haproxy pcs resource didn't get started after reboot
This change adds some extra info to be displayed to make
 troubleshooting easier.

Change-Id: I50ca550d225e52ba44b76a70b1db1c34088b88d7
(cherry picked from commit 0d471e91ef52573ca3b7df259e61a0c9b4111b2c)

Change-Id: I68c5e6c6dd969934c85409b8cee9919454e88474

commit_message:
Add FFU upgrade steps to Sahara services

Those steps should be enough to have Sahara properly working,
following the patterns established by other services:
- the non-containerized services are disabled between Ocata and Pike;
- the database is upgrades.

Closes-Bug: #1780134
Change-Id: I68c5e6c6dd969934c85409b8cee9919454e88474
(cherry picked from commit e38f6e935418fc1f17ceda3c8a5e4b75aed9ef98)

[{'created': '2018-07-18 07:40:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fluentd configures rsyslog to send logs properly

Fluentd configures rsyslog on the docker, but as the /etc/rsyslog.d directory
is not mounted, the rsyslog service is not configured.

This patch add the /etc/rsyslog.d directory to the fluentd container, so
rsyslog service is configured

Closes-Bug: #1780722
Change-Id: I94bd6aaa5f9da86fa642ac1225db1aa3ad3d2754
(cherry picked from commit d30adea380f37280308d71c44c9f94e2ba3b1b15)
'}]
commit_message:
Fluentd configures rsyslog to send logs properly

Fluentd configures rsyslog on the docker, but as the /etc/rsyslog.d directory
is not mounted, the rsyslog service is not configured.

This patch add the /etc/rsyslog.d directory to the fluentd container, so
rsyslog service is configured

Closes-Bug: #1780722
Change-Id: I94bd6aaa5f9da86fa642ac1225db1aa3ad3d2754
(cherry picked from commit d30adea380f37280308d71c44c9f94e2ba3b1b15)

commit_message:
Copy-in libvirt certs via kolla extended/start

Instead of bind-mounting directly into the libvirt container,
follow the established approach for ditributing certificates
in containers.

Change-Id: Icdec38004df28988aa3a62019cb092c59d915f0e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit be5fd4eaeb514d659e1c684bfbd084aee9e7d519)

commit_message:
Workload flavor customization.

In order to spawn workload vms with images different than cirros,
 it might be needed to adjust disk's size/vcpus/swap's size.
This change allows this customization leaving defaults intact.

Change-Id: Iee64ad8843bc7827cf1101544b1c52c69fa49298
(cherry picked from commit 0228961c2a30cfd5b19addea0b41f349526fcd96)

Previously we missed to enable http mode for the Swift and Ceph
RGW listeners in HAProxy.

commit_message:
OVN: Add exec puppet tag to ovn-controller service file

The depends on patch (in puppet-ovn) now makes use of "exec" to set
mac table size of provider bridges. We need "exec" puppet tag
to run that successfully.

Depends-On: I8f392c7807c4c6a152dfa4b77c7f4350b44324c0
Change-Id: Ie7f000c658cab31dd6f453e02b55ac244d0328e2
Closes-bug: #1779706

commit_message:
Add default for ceph_ansible_playbook in update/upgrade prepare workflow

The end goal here is to remove it completely, but there's a
chicken-and-egg issue between removing it from tripleoclient and
tripleo-common. First we default it here, then we remove it from
tripleoclient, then we remove it here.

Partial-Bug: #1783949
Change-Id: If80f9cc2f4cb32610dc5eb87159872e28363a21a

commit_message:
Update way to determine deployment status in plans list

Deployment status in plans list is now determined from deployment
status in Swift rather than from Heat stack status

Implements: blueprint config-download-ui
Change-Id: I6717b5e9141f38236ebac251a0afa078799e5a0b

commit_message:
Adds reproducer check+exit+warning dependencies - virtualenv+others

Running reproducer fails if you don't have python-virtualenv installed.
This adds a check and warning which is nicer than the usual error
"reproducer-quickstart.sh: line 199: virtualenv: command not found"

After discussion also added check for pip and further testing also
showed the need for ansible and openstackclient.

Related-Bug: 1769538
Change-Id: Ic4a2740ef08c3f2a9746f78b69186a4feec9af3c

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-25 13:23:04.000000000', 'message': "[WIP]Check static IPs in optional environment files

The network environment validation currently only checks the
network settings in the environments/network-environment-yaml file.
However, some operators use the environments/ips-from-pool*.yaml files
to define static IPs. These files are not validated, so errors like IP
collisions and duplications might go unnoticed if these files are used
in a deployment.

This patch extends the network environment validation to check these
files as well. But because we don't know if those files are being
used for a deployment at the of the validation, any errors found in
these files are shown as warnings, while the validation will only fail
if there are errors in the main network-environment.yaml file.

Change-Id: Ieaf7e7200ad58ee2c33428a4fd3d70fbc066b377
"}, {'created': '2017-07-25 16:25:09.000000000', 'message': "Check static IPs in optional environment files

in a deployment.

This patch extends the network environment validation to check these
files as well. But because we don't know if those files are being
used for a deployment at the of the validation, any errors found in
these files are shown as warnings, while the validation will only fail

Change-Id: Ieaf7e7200ad58ee2c33428a4fd3d70fbc066b377
"}]
commit_message:
Check static IPs in optional environment files

The network environment validation currently only checks the
network settings in the environments/network-environment-yaml file.
However, some operators use the environments/ips-from-pool*.yaml files
to define static IPs. These files are not validated, so errors like IP
collisions and duplications might go unnoticed if these files are used
in a deployment.

This patch extends the network environment validation to check these
files as well. But because we don't know if those files are being
used for a deployment at the of the validation, any errors found in
these files are shown as warnings, while the validation will only fail
if there are errors in the main network-environment.yaml file.

Change-Id: Ieaf7e7200ad58ee2c33428a4fd3d70fbc066b377

commit_message:
Remove converge env file option and re-use Deploy code

Since we inherit from DeployCommand class, we dont need to
take care of the converge env file.
It should be handle now by the -e option.
The converge env file should re-op the postdeploy step btw

Change-Id: Iab69404637686c6bb5c3872c6fb47568062e2cbc

commit_message:
Removes remaining AdminToken references

As per https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1665287 there are some
redundant references to AdminToken remaining and this removes them.
I think. I'm really not sure if this commit is correct so please
review with alacrity.

Change-Id: I748246821e7f7f138288389860d1ab216897b5e0
Closes-Bug: #1665287

commit_message:
docker: Add unit tests on service_name

This patch updates the docker services so that we maintain
the service_name (a required interface) within the docker/services
themselves rather than "extend" this value from the puppet service.

The primary benefit is that we can add unit tests on this interface.
It also simplifies the templates a bit.

Change-Id: Iee0dc78991b0e4b01018134dc61a22a2de65fb26

subject: Dont show the mistral failure when ansible has failed
messages: [{'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-01-18 10:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-31 17:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAbandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-18 10:22:58.000000000', 'message': 'Dont show the mistral failure when ansible has failed

Since we are printing all the ansible run to the console
we dont have to print the payload result when the ansible
run has failed.
If the payload message is huge, we will miss the ansible
failure output. Having only the Play Recap is enough for
being aware of the issue.

Change-Id: I5c59a2e180084c3e133ff4ea31008d567d6ad565
'}]
commit_message:
Dont show the mistral failure when ansible has failed

Since we are printing all the ansible run to the console
we dont have to print the payload result when the ansible
run has failed.
If the payload message is huge, we will miss the ansible
failure output. Having only the Play Recap is enough for
being aware of the issue.

Change-Id: I5c59a2e180084c3e133ff4ea31008d567d6ad565

commit_message:
Dynamically renders network isolation resource registry

Automatically renders the resource registry for networks and ports
defined in network_data.yaml.  This eliminates the need to use
network-isolation.yaml unless there is a desire to override the
default registry.

Also deprecates the use of 'noop.yaml' in order to fallback network VIPs
to ctlplane network.  Now if a network is disabled in network_data the
VIP object for that network will not be created, and any service that
uses that network will automatically use the ctlplane VIP.

Closes-Bug: 1721038

Change-Id: I28863cd6af188a0221ab7a8dd99af60ba506a1ab
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add additional sysctl values to enhance security

This patch adds several sysctl values that improve
secutiry of the system (see LP bug).

Also it disables setting of ipv6 values if it is disabled.

Closes-Bug: #1669739

Change-Id: Ie23c0f4cabb3cb682bf67e10dc45e3254794950d

commit_message:
Enforce npm version when building the project

Yes, this is a hack.  Unfortunately, bindep is useless when checking for
versions, and npm's own "engines" and "engineStrict" settings don't even
provide a warning mechanism (let alone enforcement).

Change-Id: I6187119a6be0db49ed97acedc02afdc2b908a416

commit_message:
Upgrade to npm 5

This means a few things:

* Updating the verify-version script
* Updating the shrinkwrap file to the new lockfile format

Change-Id: Ic8763fb4239a380253defdf07f5a45368707fc01

commit_message:
Set nova to verify glance images in scenario 2

We do not want to set this by default when barbican is enabled because
this will prevent all unsigned images from booting, causing potential
migration issues.

This patch depends on a patch to tripleo-quickstart which creates
signed images in the tempest test environment.  Otherwise, the
existing tests will fail because unsigned images will not boot.

A subsequent patch will enable the image signing tests in oooq.

Change-Id: I2c64ba268931c2bb69158888165e286c34d40631
Depends-On: Ie62025da5bd3ea495ef706f2cd18860a94c27e16

Cinder: Add NexentaStor Support

This adds NexentaStor iSCSI backend support to cinder volume.

commit_message:
Add packages required for osprofiler

The following packages are required in-order to run osprofiler.
these packages will provide deployers the ability to profile
a service on demand should they choose to enable the profile
functionality.

Depends-On: Ife5023bc4752cf3c2d7221f9f8772990c6bc09df
Change-Id: I8d022156ee5dd6fc30e33f822b40a7bc885ed13e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Make docker.yaml and docker-ha.yaml default env file

This patch makes docker.yaml and docker-ha.yaml env files
default during overcloud deployment defaulting to containarised
services deployment. This ensures that it is default for both
CLI and UI.

Change-Id: Iad84df670cacfb822f8ccddff46dc2819426ceb1
Closes-Bug: #1701532

commit_message:
Install package "less" in all tripleo containers

All tripleo container images that extend openstack-base currently
have "less" installed, due to a rpm dependency.

Install this package explicitely, and make it available for all
container images (e.g. swift, redis, mariadb, rabbitmq...)

Closes-Bug: #1723051

Change-Id: Ie02be0d27f6450a619973c4c0c61f32862d81041

commit_message:
Wrap interface function for multihash correctly

The store_add_to_backend_with_multihash() function was not wrapped
correctly so that Glance could consume the secure hash value.  This
patch adds the correct wrapping.

Closes-bug: #1784420

Change-Id: I7a94dfffb61fc212abb58c1e1aec5884474b6aa8

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
WIP test for an "all" neutron_driver for build pipelines

This change adds an "all" option to the neutron_driver template
mapping, which gives image build pipelines an option to ensure there
are image entries for ovn, odl, and plain ovs.

Change-Id: Ib3fecae4b42d7cde941a3208bb0e256a5eb06740

commit_message:
Set coe_ facts for APBs

The coe_* variables are accepted by APBs to tell where to find
Kubernetes and which credentials to use to access it.

Change-Id: Ic80b0034356d62963c4f510d0f2e181126161bda

commit_message:
WIP: Mount etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf in all db_sync containers

I had to fix this in cinder-api to get a TLS deployment working with
containers. Also had to include this for ec2api in
https://review.openstack.org/520547.

I've not looked at any of the other services yet but I suspect some/all
will aslo fail in db sync when deploying TLS & containers.

Change-Id: I61a77823778d6b25b67c56031ffb900f97828850

'}]
commit_message:
Remove repeated role of copying,

seems like the post copying role is repeated so many times in
post.yaml run, which can be removed.

Change-Id: Iaef91d7b048283c15f099aeee433ed1e994ee876

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I8b85b36ea371bff8d3861123749ed05efbf0d295

commit_message:
Check the role data flags and failed is missing

Check the roles data flags and failed is
the required flags is not set.
The patch is needed for upgrade to ensure
that the old roles data file has all
the deprecated flags

Change-Id: I66e694d51ea45e2c37940502140dbf34c730906e

Please explain why this is necessary. Will there be other configs volumes for ODL?
We have other examples in t-h-t where the container name doesn't match the config_volume and I think it's fine."}, {'account_id': 20866, 'date': '2017-10-05 09:24:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Please explain why this is necessary. Will there be other configs
 > volumes for ODL?
 > We have other examples in t-h-t where the container name doesn't
 > match the config_volume and I think it's fine.

There can be ODL related ovs config volume once ovs is moved to containers."}, {'account_id': 20866, 'date': '2017-10-05 14:27:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > Please explain why this is necessary. Will there be other configs
 > > volumes for ODL?
 > > We have other examples in t-h-t where the container name doesn't
 > > match the config_volume and I think it's fine.
 > 
 > There can be ODL related ovs config volume once ovs is moved to
 > containers.

To be clear, once ovs is containarised, there would be opendaylight_ovs config volume and renaming current opendaylight volume to opendaylight_api would be less confusing"}, {'account_id': 13039, 'date': '2017-10-24 06:42:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Renaming a config volume has more implication than you think. Operators need to adapt their scripts to the new name and we also need to update tools such as sosreport. It's not a trivial change.

In this case I don't think a config_volume named 'opendaylight' is confusing as it is the one used by the ODL service. Also it's not confirmed that we'll need a second config_volume for opendaylight_ovs, they could very well share the same 'opendaylight' config_volume."}, {'account_id': 20866, 'date': '2017-10-24 06:50:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Renaming a config volume has more implication than you think.
 > Operators need to adapt their scripts to the new name and we also
 > need to update tools such as sosreport. It's not a trivial change.
 > 
 > In this case I don't think a config_volume named 'opendaylight' is
 > confusing as it is the one used by the ODL service. Also it's not
 > confirmed that we'll need a second config_volume for
 > opendaylight_ovs, they could very well share the same
 > 'opendaylight' config_volume.

Ok then, I am keeping this as backup incase we need to change it later on"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:57:37.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

commit_message:
Make config_volume consistent with ODL container name

Change volume name to opendaylight_api, same as container name

Change-Id: Idc8d5817f8c9187546cc195fd5a21bc1dcc1c99f
Depends-On: I750b85bdb0f5c27dc38a4dbfc5bb5238561c1a71

subject: Add call to workflow to store DNS entries in IPA
messages:
[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-03-13 18:52:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-03-13 19:30:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

sorry for the -2, but workflow_tasks is being deprecated in Rocky and will no longer be supported due to the switch to using config-download.

further, where you're adding the workflow_tasks in overcloud.j2.yaml would have no effect anyway.

You probably want to look into external_deploy_tasks or deploy_steps_tasks, and use a service template to create those tasks. This will allow you to specify ansible tasks that you can run directly.

external_deploy_tasks run on the undercloud. Looking at what you're doing in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/552660/1/playbooks/novajoin-dns.yaml, I think this is what you want.

feel free to ping me on irc if you want to discuss further."}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-03-13 20:46:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was originally going to try and get this into stable/Queens - which is why I was going the mistral route.  I was still in the process of testing these changes, but if workflow_tasks wont work in overcloud.j2.yaml, then I'll go with the external_deploy_tasks route."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-04-09 18:23:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I was originally going to try and get this into stable/Queens -
 > which is why I was going the mistral route.  I was still in the
 > process of testing these changes, but if workflow_tasks wont work
 > in overcloud.j2.yaml, then I'll go with the external_deploy_tasks
 > route.

if you need this supported in Queens, you can use workflow_tasks, but that won't be supported in Rocky, where you'd need to use external_deploy_tasks or deploy_steps_tasks."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-04-09 18:26:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > I was originally going to try and get this into stable/Queens -
 > > which is why I was going the mistral route.  I was still in the
 > > process of testing these changes, but if workflow_tasks wont work
 > > in overcloud.j2.yaml, then I'll go with the external_deploy_tasks
 > > route.
 > 
 > if you need this supported in Queens, you can use workflow_tasks,
 > but that won't be supported in Rocky, where you'd need to use
 > external_deploy_tasks or deploy_steps_tasks.

I should clarify that config-download wasn't fully supported in Queens and isn't the default behavior in Queens, which is why you may choose to use workflow_tasks for Queens. Just something to keep in mind depending on what your goals are."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-07-31 16:55:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this patch per the TripleO Patch Abandonment guidelines (https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/policy/patch-abandonment.html). If you wish to have this restored and cannot do so yourself, please reach out via #tripleo on freenode or the OpenStack Dev mailing list.'}]

I'm unsure about this change to be honest and its whole purpose. It sounds like to me a bunch of workarounds and things we shouldn't even do in quickstart in a first glance."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2018-01-15 19:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Seems a bit overcomplex to me. Do we really need different versions of heat-templates for overcloud and undercloud?'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-01-16 09:36:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> Do we really need different versions of heat-templates for overcloud and undercloud?

One place we probably do need this is testing of upgrades, we'll want to deploy latest/master undercloud, then deploy the N-1 overcloud, then update t-h-t and upgrade to the latest overcloud.

AIUI that was the use-case that motivated this change, e.g testing of upgrades?"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-01-16 09:39:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-01-16 09:42:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

One observation (and I know it's a general tripleo-quickstart problem) is we've got a bunch of duplication here - it'd be way nicer to have a single reusable role with some tasks in it, vs a giant script template with a bunch of hard-coded conditionals related to overcloud/undercloud.

Not blocking on that, but IMHO it's something we should really seek to improve instead of perpetuate in quickstart, we're missing most of the nice aspects of ansible with the script-all-the-things approach."}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-01-16 10:29:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-16 10:32:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> a bunch of duplication here - it'd be way nicer to have a single reusable role

+1 to that.
For my case, I've composed playbooks for UC and overcloud deployments using the existing role and overcloud_templates_* variables. Although for upgrades testing we might need a propery namespaced variables as proposed in this patch"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-16 10:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2018-01-16 16:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-01-16 18:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

I'm blocking it until Lukas can comment on the review. I agree with Steve here, it sounds very complex now."}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-01-29 13:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-01-29 14:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

This version starts to look cleaner but there is small bug.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-08 19:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp/containerized-undercloud to undercloud'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-02-19 12:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-04-06 10:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11166, 'date': '2018-04-06 10:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Introduce undercloud_templates_* variables

Containerized undercloud requires THT which in our case can be in
different version for Overcloud and for Undercloud. To solve this
we add undercloud_templates_* variables and we by default get only
overcloud templates, unless undercloud_templates_path is different
from overcloud_templates_path.

Change-Id: I324c927fa0ebf7d625271d596d2bab3ed1d2e833

commit_message:
Promote bast-test change for configure-unbound

This has been tested with:

  http://logs.openstack.org/28/587128/1/check/windmill-fedora-latest/c1fb677/job-output.txt.gz

And does seem to address the validate-host error:

  No viable v4 or v6 route found to git.openstack.org. The build node is
  assumed to be invalid

Change-Id: Ib9145d91de9b5cd574cbe203037a2144dcd53b9a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create import-role role.

This ansible role allows us loading other
roles setting a specific branch, to then
be used from any ansible playbook.

Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>

Closes-Bug: #1749740

Change-Id: I9d7aa7286b4de51e5b08dec11cf9ed6672352cfa

in updates job, we need to deploy a good know hash that is anterior the
the latest.
This release file will be used in updates jobs, and will install the

everything to the latest hash

Change-Id: I9d56606fd034415d450a32cd04e537713e340ff9
'}]
commit_message:
Add previous master release

in updates job, we need to deploy a good know hash that is anterior the
the latest.
This release file will be used in updates jobs, and will install the
previous known good hash first, so the update process can then update
everything to the latest hash

Change-Id: I9d56606fd034415d450a32cd04e537713e340ff9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-31 10:19:46.000000000', 'message': 'Remove dosfstools-dbg package from ubuntu installs

This packages was added in [1] without an explanation of why the
debug symbols are required. The symbols package is not built for
bionic [2] so we remove it allowing the common vars file to work
for both Xenial and Bionic releases.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/e771983f2cb05f8b6912bcf02e661658d9970fc0
[2] http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/d/dosfstools/dosfstools_4.1-1.dsc

Change-Id: I283628e6d42c6708934975d272712353472e066b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dosfstools-dbg package from ubuntu installs

This packages was added in [1] without an explanation of why the
debug symbols are required. The symbols package is not built for
bionic [2] so we remove it allowing the common vars file to work
for both Xenial and Bionic releases.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/e771983f2cb05f8b6912bcf02e661658d9970fc0
[2] http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/main/d/dosfstools/dosfstools_4.1-1.dsc

Change-Id: I283628e6d42c6708934975d272712353472e066b

Adjust Vitrage api to support Prometheus datasource

This includes adding support to basic mode auth along side to keystone auth.

documentation commits coming after

commit_message:
Tempest: change manifests.pvc to pvc.enabled from pvc-tempest.yaml

This PS remove change pvc-tempest.yaml from manifests.pvc to
pvc.enabled as there is no manifests enabled value for pvc.
Bug was tempest pod is in pending state as pvc is not found.

Change-Id: Ib6704725c7415e95237f633d340479e33b43d85b

commit_message:
Add missing services and collect journal logs

This change adds several services to the collection list which are part
of our deliverables yet we've no logging for. This change also
implements journal log collection when a given service is found which
should help folks better debug issues with various services, especially
as we transition to all journal logging.

Change-Id: Ie6f06eb5b0488005263aed397fab7dedc5a287a0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

a "future" status since validation was add/changed since the

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 00:01:50.000000000', 'message': "Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete

Previously when doing a delete in convergence, we spawned a new thread to
start the delete. This was to ensure the request returned without waiting
for potentially slow operations like deleting snapshots and stopping
existing workers (which could have caused RPC timeouts).

The result, however, was that the stack was not guaranteed to be
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS by the time the request returned. In the case where a
previous delete had failed, a client request to show the stack issued soon
after the delete had returned would likely show the stack status as
DELETE_FAILED still. Only a careful examination of the updated_at timestamp
would reveal that this corresponded to the previous delete and not the one
just issued. In the case of a nested stack, this could leave the parent
stack effectively undeletable. (Since the updated_at time is not modified
on delete in the legacy path, we never checked it when deleting a nested
stack.)

To prevent this, change the order of operations so that the stack is first
put into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state before the delete_stack call returns.
Only after the state is stored, spawn a thread to complete the operation.

Since there is no stack lock in convergence, this gives us the flexibility
to cancel other in-progress workers after we've already written to the
Stack itself to start a new traversal. (In fact, this may prevent another
possible race, since updating the current traversal ID prevents new
operations starting from queued messages after we have cancelled the
in-progress operations.)

The previous patch in the series means that snapshots are now also deleted
after the stack is marked as DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. This is consistent with
the legacy path.

Change-Id: Ib767ce8b39293c2279bf570d8399c49799cbaa70
Story: #1669608
Task: 23174

Story: #1669608

commit_message:
Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete

Previously when doing a delete in convergence, we spawned a new thread to
start the delete. This was to ensure the request returned without waiting
for potentially slow operations like deleting snapshots and stopping
existing workers (which could have caused RPC timeouts).

The result, however, was that the stack was not guaranteed to be
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS by the time the request returned. In the case where a
previous delete had failed, a client request to show the stack issued soon
after the delete had returned would likely show the stack status as
DELETE_FAILED still. Only a careful examination of the updated_at timestamp
would reveal that this corresponded to the previous delete and not the one
just issued. In the case of a nested stack, this could leave the parent
stack effectively undeletable. (Since the updated_at time is not modified
on delete in the legacy path, we never checked it when deleting a nested
stack.)

To prevent this, change the order of operations so that the stack is first
put into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state before the delete_stack call returns.
Only after the state is stored, spawn a thread to complete the operation.

Since there is no stack lock in convergence, this gives us the flexibility
to cancel other in-progress workers after we've already written to the
Stack itself to start a new traversal.

The previous patch in the series means that snapshots are now also deleted
after the stack is marked as DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. This is consistent with
the legacy path.

Change-Id: Ib767ce8b39293c2279bf570d8399c49799cbaa70
Story: #1669608
Task: 23174
